children.subject: <md>Maybe contact Sinclair directly? He is teaching 172 this year so maybe drop by office hours?</md>

history.content:
<md>I asked Prof. Sinclair and this was his response: 

Thanks for your interest in CS271.

Caveat: I may be on sabbatical next year (postponed from last year due to Covid), which would mean that CS271 won't be taught until the following year (2022-23). 

If CS271 does happen this Fall, I hope to have space for some well-qualified undergraduates (space permitting--I do have to give priority to graduate students).  "Well-qualified" means very good grades in relevant Theory/Math courses (CS170, plus some other relevant undergrad classes in CS, EE, Math or Stat).  CS172 certainly counts for that.  If you've already taken a relevant Grad class that's even better (but not essential).  You should also only consider taking this class if you are really interested in theory and are not struggling with related material in other classes.  At this stage I'm keeping a waitlist, and won't be able to confirm any undergrad enrollments until my sabbatical is settled and I have more details about likely graduate enrollment.  So it is essential that you have a Plan B in place.

If you would like me to put you on the waitlist for CS271, please send me a brief email.

I hope this is helpful and I apologize for the uncertainty.

AS</md>
Does anyone know how we can enroll in CS 271 for fall? Do I have to email the professor as an undergrad?
history.subject: CS 271 Enrollment
